definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: offend, be guilty (Ar. 0’a3ima, id., 0’a3ama, reum judicavit, 0’a3a0mun, 0’i3amun, fault, guilt, mulct, cf. Eth. h.3am:)—[[אָשַׁם]] Le 5:19, Nu 5:7; [[אָשֵׁם]] Hb Hab 1:11 + 7 t.; [[אָֽשְׁמָה]] Nu 5:6; [[אָשָָׁמְתָּ]] Pr 30:10; [[אָשַׁמְתְּ]] Ez Eze 22:4; [[אָשֵָׁמוּ]] Le 4:13; Impf. [[יֶאְשַׁם]] Ho 4:15 + 13 t.; Inf. abs. [[אָשׁׂם]] Le 5:19; [[אָשׁוֹם]] Ez Eze 25:12; —

commit an offence, a trespass, do a wrong, or an injury, with [[לְ]]:[[אָשׁׂם אָשַׁם ליהוה ]] he hath done a great wrong to Yahweh (in violating the commands) Le 5:19 (P); [[וְנׇתַן לַאֲשֶׁר אָשַׁם לוֹ]] and he shall give it (restitution) to him to whom he did wrong Nu 5:7 (P), cf. 2Ch 19:10, 2Ch 19:10; [[וַיֶאְשְׁמוּ אָשׁוֹם]] and they committed lasting wrong (irreparable wrong, the Edomites against Judah) Ez Eze 25:12.

be or become guilty Ju Jdg 21:22, Je 50:7, Ho 4:15, Hb Hab 1:11; in offences requiring sin-offering Le 4:13, Le 4:22, Le 4:27 (P), of trespass-offering Le 5:2, Le 5:3, Le 5:17, Le 5:23, Nu 5:6 (P); with [[ל]] guilty of Le 5:4, Le 5:5 (P), with [[ב]] in or through Ez Eze 22:4, Ho 13:1.
be held guilty, bear punishment Ps 34:22, Ps 34:23, Pr 30:10, Is 24:6, Je 2:3, Ho 5:15, Ho 10:2, Ho 14:1, Zec 11:5, Ez Eze 6:6 (but cf. [[שָׁמֵם]]).

definitions.title: Hiph.
definitions.body: Impf. sf. [[הַאֲשִׁימֵם]] declare them guilty Ps 5:11.
